alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 5:13PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lake and west central Volusia Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 513 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Pittman, or 9 miles southeast of Juniper Springs, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pierson, Barberville, Paisley, Eldridge and Forest Hills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
